ColumnCast.KitText: #> ColumnCast Rating --type int --exampleTitle Cast Single Column --example Our rating was initially a decimal number, but we would rather it be an integer. We cast the Rating column to an integer to remove the decimal values.
ColumnCast.ExampleDescription: Our rating was initially a decimal number, but we would rather it be an integer. We cast the Rating column to an integer to remove the decimal values.

ColumnCast.KitText: #> ColumnCast Specialty Pizza Established Year --type string --exampleTitle Cast Multiple Columns --example Rather than casting a single columns, cast multiple columns to a data type simply by specifying multiiple column names.
ColumnCast.CodeAfterKit:
pizzeriasDf['Specialty Pizza'] = pizzeriasDf['Specialty Pizza'].astype('str')
pizzeriasDf['Established Year'] = pizzeriasDf['Established Year'].astype('str')
ColumnCast.ExampleDescription: Rather than casting a single columns, cast multiple columns to a data type simply by specifying multiiple column names.
